# boneWeights

**Instance Property**

The geometry source that defines the influence of each bone on the positions the geometry’s vertices.

## Declaration

```swift
var boneWeights: SCNGeometrySource { get }
```

## Discussion

This geometry source’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometrySource/semantic-swift.property] property must be [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometrySource/Semantic-swift.struct/boneWeights]. Its data is an array of floating-point vectors, whose [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometrySource/componentsPerVector] count is the number of bones influencing each vertex. Each vector corresponds to a vertex in the geometry’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometrySource/Semantic-swift.struct/vertex] geometry source, and each component in a vector specifies the influence of a bone on that vertex’s position. The [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSkinner/boneIndices] source determines which nodes in the bones array correspond to each component in the vector. A component value of `0.0` means that the bone has no influence on that vertex; positive or negative values scale the transformation of a bone node before SceneKit applies that transformation to the vertex.



## Working with an Animation Skeleton

- **skeleton**: The root node of the skinner object’s animation skeleton.
- **bones**: The control nodes of the animation skeleton.
- **boneInverseBindTransforms**: The default transforms for the animation skeleton’s bone nodes.
- **boneIndices**: The geometry source defining the mapping from bone indices in skeleton data to the skinner’s bones array.
